pacman

Class GameCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.GameCharacter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Monster, PacMan

    public abstract class GameCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Tom Leibovich and Roee Shachar 'Game Character' represents a moving object in the game panel. It contains its location in the matrix, and in the game panel image, its speed, different icons for each movement and methods that determine how will it move in the panel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameCharacter

        public GameCharacter(GamePanel parent,
             int startPixelX,
             int startPixelY,
             int startMatrixX,
             int startMatrixY,
             javax.swing.ImageIcon icon,
             int direction,
             int speed)
        A constructor for a new Game Character.
        Parameters:
        parent - - The game panel
        startPixelX - - The X position (in the image) the character starts a new game from, and the position it goes back to once beaten by a another character.
        startPixelY - - The Y position (in the image) the character starts a new game from, and the position it goes back to once beaten by a another character.
        startMatrixX - - The X position (in the matrix) the character starts a new game from, and the position it goes back to once beaten by a another character.
        startMatrixY - - The Y position (in the matrix) the character starts a new game from, and the position it goes back to once beaten by a another character.
        icon - - The icon of the character at the beginning of the game.
        direction - - The initial direction of the character
        speed - - How many pixels the character moves in each step.

      • goToStart

        public void goToStart()
        Sends the character to its start position, in case beaten by a another character.

      • isLegalMove

        public boolean isLegalMove(int direction)
        'isLegalMove' checks whether the next direction is an obstale or the end of the image.
        Parameters:
        direction - - The desired direction
        Returns:
        - True - If the move is legal, False - otherwise

      • move

        public boolean move()
        'Move' determines how the character will move based on the current direction chosen. In each call to this method, it calls the method 'isLegalMove' to check whether the step is legal, and calculates the character's next location based on its speed.
        Returns:
        True - if the move was accomplished successfully, False - otherwise.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int direction)
        Sets the next direction, and changes the icon of the character accordingly
        Parameters:
        direction -
